entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, 2023 edition

div.p: The 2023 edition of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus is now available. Revisions include the following:

ul.li:
Corpus:
CPG 2433: Added seven new transcriptions.
CPG 2440: changed authorship to improbable, reflecting Géhin's viewpoint.
CPG 2443: added two Greek editions, one translation.
CPG 2444: added reference to Armenian version; added one Greek edition, one translation.
CPG 2445: added reference to Armenian version; added two Greek editions, one translation.
CPG 2448: removed references to Armenian version (none is known).
CPG 2455: added transcription for Vat. gr. 754.
CPG 2463: added transcriptions for Greek, Arabic
CPG 2464: added transcription for Arabic
CPG 2464a: added transcription for Arabic
NO CPG 06: newly added Word of Instruction, eighteen kephalaia preserved in Barb. gr. 515 and in various Armenian manuscripts. Not yet properly edited. Because these kephalaia were presented in the context of Muyldermans's studies on the Capita cognoscitiva (CPG 2433), and because they did not feature in the KG supplements, they have been overlooked by modern cataloguing efforts.
NO CPG 07: newly added. A block of nine kephalaia, preserved in Syriac, the Armenian KG Supplement (nos. 13-22) and Armenian letter 24. The title is identical to Disciples 191, and kephalaia nos. 1, 5, 6, and 7 correspond to Disciples 192, 220, 221, and 222 in the Greek. But the independent manuscript witness suggests that this was a small work in its own right, and that compiler of Disciples selectively drew from it.
Bibliography: 7 items added.

entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, 2022 edition

div.p: The 2022 edition of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus is now available.
The following changes have been made

ul.li: Bibliography: 32 items added, 11 additional items updated.

Corpus: Modifications to a number of the short descriptions. The Greek text of the Scholia on Psalms (2455) is now available, correcting roughly 20 typographic errors in the 2021 print edition by Rondeau et al. The Syriac and French of Counsel (2475) has now been provided, along with the Greek fragments preserved in Furrer-Pilliod's edition of the Definitions and Descriptions.

entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, 2021 edition

div.p: The 2021 edition of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus is now available. Quarterly 2020 editions were not created because major upgrades were being developed for the Guide. Starting with this issue, the Guide moves to an annual publication cycle, with new issues arriving in late December.
Google Analytics has been removed, in part to comply with GDPR, and for other reasons outlined here.
The contact form has been simplified to human-readable email address.

The checklist of writings has been streamlined in appearance, and easier access has been provided for transcriptions and parallel editions. The parallel editions now come in two types, one for enhanced searching and the other for enhanced reading. The search-enhanced editions prioritize word joins to allow for easier browser-based research. The reading-enhanced editions provide more styling of the sources, and when versions in the same group are quite close, they are combined in a synthetic reading that shows precisely where the versions diverge, and statistics behind the immediate difference.

Reading editions have more option controls over visualization. When based on a TAN-A file that includes claims about quotations, the relevant extracts from the quoted texts are also provided. Vocabulary for types of text reuse (quoting, referring, alluding, paraphrasing, etc.) are explained.
Much of the new functionality is based upon tools in the Text Alignment Network, version 2020, development branch.

entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, winter 2019 edition

div.p: The winter 2019 edition of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus is now available. Summer and autumn 2019 editions were not created because major work was being performed, upgrading features of the Guide.

The checklist of writings has been completely overhauled with a new transformation algorithm. Most importantly, the checklist of editions, translations, transcriptions, etc. has been moved from the Zotero database to a TAN-A file, which allows for RDF-like assertions with great precision. I am not very happy with the state of the XSLT that does the transformation, because nearly every template feels like a hack. But in the interest of getting out a new version of the Guide, I have decided to let it stand, warts and all. For the first time, now, users will be able to find easily transcriptions from manuscripts, previously on the site but not integrated into the checklist. So far, only CPG 2430 and CPG 2431 (Praktikos and Gnostikos) have entries that exhibit the kind of accuracy I'd like to see across the entire publication.

The bibliography now has a tag urn for every entry, logged in the field labeled "extra". This makes it possible to use the Zotero database in conjunction with the TAN library, so that assertions made in the TAN files can be linked to more complete metadata.

entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, winter 2016 edition

div.p: The winter 2016 edition of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus is now available.

This edition constitutes a major update to the bibliography and corpus pages and the way they are populated. The data for the corpus is now housed primarily in a TAN-c file (part of a new format of XML files; see http://textalign.net/) and partly in the Zotero database, which is the primary source for the bibliography. Exhibit, the javascript library that undergirded the corpus and bibliography, has been replaced by Tablesorter, written by Christian Bach and updated by Rob Garrison (https://github.com/Mottie/tablesorter). Between the data and the javascript library rests several custom-written XSLT files that transform the TAN-c and Zotero.rdf into the html tables that populate the now-static website.
The advantage to this approach is that all editions of the Guide are now archivable by archive.org. The two pages slightly smaller and more responsive, generally. They are cleaner and more book-like.
Along with the data overhaul has come a revision of the CSS, which is now designed to be adequate for both small and large screens.
Other revisions include the following:

ul.li: Bibliography: 1 item added, 31 additional items updated.

entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, autumn 2015 edition

div.p: The autumn 2015 edition of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus is available. Revisions include the following:

ul.li: corpus: permanent, unique URNs have been assigned to all the works of Evagrius. These are itemized for each work, and follow the formula "tag:evagriusponticus.net,2015:" + "cpg" + [CPG number]. If the work is not listed in the Clavis patrium graecorum, the URN is constructed "tag:evagriusponticus.net,2015:" + "nocpg" + [2-digit number]. These URNs are suitable for naming the abstract concept of the works of Evagrius, and may be used by anyone in any digital data set or project. Note, these URNs apply only to the work level of Evagrius's works, and should not be used to name any manuscript or edition that carries a particular work.

transcriptions: In preparation for publishing multiple versions of transcriptions of each of Evagrius's works, the Github repository https://github.com/Arithmeticus/TAN-Evagrius has been prepared and will be deployed in a future version.

entry.title: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus arrives

div.p: We are pleased to announce the appearance of the Guide to Evagrius Ponticus, a digital-only, peer-reviewed reference work. Updated quarterly, the Guide provides definitive lists of Evagrius's works, of editions and translations of those works, and of studies related to his life and thought. The Guide includes a sourcebook of key ancient testimonies to Evagrius and his reception, as well as a checklist of images from the ancient world. Updated quarterly, the Guide will gradually introduce a manuscript checklist, images of manuscripts, transcriptions of those manuscripts, and open source critical editions of Evagrius's writings.

entry.title: New Guide two weeks away

div.p: Guide to Evagrius Ponticus arriving 17 January 2012. This peer-reviewed reference work will be updated quarterly, presenting critical reference tools for the study of this fourth-century monastic theologian.
